tit.e: Jigenin/Shimobito (government official who were not allowed to see the emperor)
tit.cmt: /Shimobito (government official who were not allowed to see the emperor) を追記しました。参考：http://books.google.com/books?id=fNQjDQ-mWYgC&pg=PA236&dq=jigenin&lr=&as_brr=3&hl=ja&cd=10#v=onepage&q=jigenin&f=false
tit.e: Jigenin/Shimobito (government official who were not allowed to see the emperor)

sen.j: 地下人（じげにん/しもびと）は、日本における貴族身分の一つ。
sen.e: Jigenin was one of Japanese noble statuses.
Jigenin' or 'Shimobito' is one of the statuses of aristocrats in Japan.
Jigenin' or 'Shimobito' is one of the statuses of aristocrats in Japan.

sen.j: 単に地下（じげ）ともいう。
sen.e: Jigenin can be simply called Jige.
Jigenin can also be called simply 'jige.'
Jigenin can also be called simply 'jige.'

sen.j: 昇殿の勅許を得ていない官吏・官人のこと。
sen.e: Jigenin was a court official who was not given imperial sanction to enter the Imperial Palace.
Jigenin was a court official who was not given imperial sanction to access to the imperial court.
sen.cmt: enter the Imperial Palace をaccess to the imperial court に修正しました。
sen.e: Jigenin was a court official who was not given imperial sanction to access to the imperial court.

sen.j: 後に同様の身分である武士や庶民も含んで呼称されるようになった。
sen.e: Later, samurai warriors and commoners of the corresponding status were also called Jigenin.
Later, samurai warriors and commoners of the corresponding status were also called Jigenin.
Later, samurai warriors and commoners of the corresponding status were also called Jigenin.

sen.j: 明治時代以降、侯爵や伯爵などの華族に列せられた家でも、元公家でなければ地下人と呼ばれた。
sen.e: Even the families which were conferred upon the title of nobility as Count or Viscount after the Meiji period were called Jigenin if they were not originally a court nobles.
Even the families which were conferred upon the title of the peerage such as count or viscount after the Meiji period were called Jigenin if they were not originally court nobles.
sen.cmt: nobility as Count or Viscount を the peerage such as count or viscount に修正しました。if they were not originally a court nobles の a を削除しました。
sen.e: Even the families which were conferred upon the title of the peerage such as count or viscount after the Meiji period were called Jigenin if they were not originally court nobles.

sen.j: 原則として三位の位階を得れば（公卿身分の獲得）昇殿が許され、四位・五位の貴族や六位でも蔵人の地位にあるものは勅許があれば昇殿が許されていた（殿上人）。
sen.e: In principle, if an official obtained third rank, i.e., status of high ranked noble, the official was permitted to enter the Imperial Palace; however, a noble of fourth or fifth rank, or a chamberlain of even six rank, if they were given imperial sanction, they were permitted to enter the Imperial Palace (see 'Tenjobito').
sen.cmt: 「昇殿」はリンク先の「殿上人」と入れかわったものと思われますので、訂正して訳しました。
sen.e: In principle, if an official obtained the third rank, i.e., status of high court noble, he was permitted to enter the Imperial Palace; however, a noble of the fourth or fifth rank, or a chamberlain of even the sixth rank, if they were given imperial sanction, they were permitted to enter the Imperial Palace ('Tenjobito').

sen.cmt: if they were given imperial sanction, they were permitted to enter the Imperial Palace ('Tenjobito').→even a chamberlain of the sixth rank were permitted to enter the Imperial Palace ('Tenjobito') if they were given imperial sanction.

sen.j: 逆に言えば、これに当てはまらない者が地下人にあたるわけであるが、原則的には当然に勅許を得られるはずの公卿であっても政治的・個人的理由で勅許を得られない者も地下人であり、これを「地下の公卿」・「地下の上達部」と呼んだ。
sen.e: Conversely, those who do not match these conditions are Jigenin--A high ranked noble, who should have been given imperial sanction according to the principle but was not given imperial sanction for a political or personal reason, was classified as Jigenin, called 'a high ranked noble of Jige' 'kandachime of Jige'.

Conversely, those who do not match these conditions are Jigenin--A high ranked noble, who should have been given imperial sanction according to the principle but was not given due to political or personal reasons, was classified as Jigenin, called 'a high ranked noble of Jige' 'kandachime of Jige'.
sen.cmt: but was not given imperial sanction for a political or personal reason をbut was not given due to political or personal reasons に修正しました。

sen.j: 四位・五位の地下人は「地下の諸大夫」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: Jigenin of fourth or fifth rank was called 'shodaibu of Jige'.
Jigenin of fourth or fifth rank was called 'shodaibu (masters) of Jige'.
sen.cmt: shodaibu に (masters) を追記しました。
sen.e: Jigenin of fourth or fifth rank was called 'shodaibu (masters) of Jige'.

sen.j: 中世以後、次第に家格が定められると、位階に関係なく昇殿できる家柄（堂上家）と地下人のままの家柄（地下家）に厳格に分けられるようになった。
sen.e: When the family ranks were defined after the middle ages, the families were clearly divided without regard to the official ranks: Toshoke, the families permitted to enter the Imperial Palace; and Jigeke, the families held the status of Jigenin.
sen.cmt: 「昇殿」はリンク先の「殿上人」と入れかわったものと思われますので、訂正して訳しました。
sen.e: When the family ranks were gradually defined after the middle ages, the families were clearly divided without regard to the official ranks: Toshoke, the families permitted to enter the Imperial Palace; and Jigeke, the families held the status of Jigenin.
sen.cmt: were defined を were gradually defined に修正しました。
